intro: Chrozophora integrifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant features heart-shaped, smooth-edged leaves that are typically dark green and arranged alternately along the stems. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, range in color from white to pale blue and are pollinated by insects. Chrozophora integrifolia is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
